text: early in the morning the beginning of
the light the bell rang I went to the
window I saw downwards and I saw a group
of about twenty zapatistas with weapons
I went downstairs I opened the door I
invited the commander to enter
commandante Dhabi's he was wearing his
traditional garments with his hat full
of color he was covered with a mask he
just said we have taken some Listowel
and we want to be sure to ask the
government not to bomb san cristobol so
I agreed and then I began this
communication with the Bishop Somalis we
were worried about the federal response
a fear of what would happen to the
people what would happen if the Federal
Army would come with all its power
against the Indians the Indian
communities were marginalized they had
been for many years struggling for the
rights
strong fighting took place we could not
imagine what the government would do
many people were killed although we
never knew how many died all Mexico was
shocked it was unexpected we were in
front not of courageous communist
guerrillas but we were in front of
people with dignity trying to have
rights
trying to have a better future a radical
solution is called for in the state of
Chiapas that means revolution this
second day of January I want to visit
from Dante Marcos to ask him to let the
tourist leaves and Listowel
simplemente Marcos at that moment was
wearing his full military clothing with
his pipe and the movement of his hands
is very expressive I found him very
comfortable very confident serious but
kind no one would imagine that anyone
especially no nor the Indians would
organize such a rebellion for many years
the Diocese of San Cristobal had been
working for the rights of the Deacons
people and so the landowners and the
government people with accused us of
being organizers of the rebellion of the
Indian
on the 12th of January of 1994 the
government decided to cease fire it was
not an agreement but if it was the
result of the first contact with the
Sabbath Easter's volunteer soldiers of
the Zapatista army remained ready for
action
20 years after this event I can see the
reality of Chiapas when I go visit in
the communities I find many people that
were involved some of them are still
members of the Sabbath Easter Army I see
them still with hope with the energy to
keep struggling they will never go again
to servitude
